description: Erection of part two-storey/part single storey rear extension. Erection of rear piggyback roof extension with 2nos side dormer roof extensions and rear Juliet balcony with installation of 4nos. side rooflights to facilitate loft conversion.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any windows or rooflights at [SPECIFY FLOOR LEVEL] or above in the [SPECIFY ELEVATION(S)] shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with and permanently retained in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any windows or rooflights at proposed loft/ dormer levels or above in the  prorposed side elevations facing towards no 91 and no 87 Shortlands Road (Proposed Front and Side Elevations Drawing No 103 Rev A  and Proposed Rear and Side Elevations Drawing No 104 Rev B) shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with and permanently retained in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, a Fire Safety Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Fire Safety Strategy shall demonstrate how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety and shall include the following details:1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point; 2) appropriate fire alarm systems; 3) passive and active fire safety measures; 4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread; 5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuation strategy; 6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Fire Safety Strategy and thereafter maintained. The Submitted RES does not provide / cover all of the necessary informationThe required Fire Safety Strategy shall reference the London Plan Guidance for Fire Safety (February 2022) where applicable. A Reasonable Exception Statement shall be submitted where the Applicant considers parts of or all of Policy D12(A) of the London Plan 2021 to not be relevant. Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users, in accordance with Policy D12 of the London Plan 2021.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, the Juliet Balcony shall be fitted with and permanently retained in either a solid / opaque material or in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
